definition: to fall/fig. to suffer a setback
to throw down/to fall/to drop and break
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I was baffled that some ofthe most basic workplace blunders seem to be tripping people up!
sentences.chinese: 許多最基本的職場失誤會讓他們摔跟頭，這讓我困惑。

sentences.english: Because of caring about, but trips and falls.
A father is a walking stick, let us in life less tumble.
sentences.chinese: 父愛是柺杖，讓我們在人生中少摔跟頭。

sentences.english: Identifying the correct problem to work on is often where people trip up.
sentences.chinese: 人們經常在問題的鑑別上摔跟頭。

sentences.english: Be sure where your next step will fall, so that you will not tumble.
sentences.chinese: 要預測自己會在哪一步跌倒，這樣你就不至於摔跟頭。

sentences.english: But there are plenty of examples of strong brands hitting nasty bumps in the road.
sentences.chinese: 但是，也有很多大品牌摔跟頭的例子。

sentences.english: Without experience, we couldn't help blundering and shall no doubt blunder again.
sentences.chinese: 沒有經驗就要摔跟頭，今後也難以避免。

sentences.english: Such people are bound to trip and fall.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的人是沒有不摔跟頭的。
